meanings.definition: To pass the ball into play from out of bounds.
meanings.sent1: During the game, the player will be inbounding the ball to restart play.
meanings.sent2: The basketball team practiced inbounding the ball to improve their game strategy.
meanings.sent3: The player accidentally inbounding the ball to the wrong team caused a moment of confusion.
meanings.sent4: Inbounding the ball quickly can catch the opponents off guard.
meanings.sent5: Remember to stay behind the line when inbounding the ball to avoid penalties.

meanings.definition: The act of receiving the ball in play from out of bounds.
meanings.sent1: The inbounding of the ball is a crucial moment in a basketball game.
meanings.sent2: The player's quick reaction in the inbounding helped secure a point for the team.
meanings.sent3: The crowd cheered as the player made a spectacular inbounding catch.
meanings.sent4: Her precision in the inbounding of the ball impressed the coach.
meanings.sent5: The team's success often hinges on the efficiency of their inbounding skills.
